channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Well, You Certainly Wouldn’t Call It Presidential Underreach
item.description: Trump’s ambitious effort to impose his will on the country has only generated discontent and backlash.

item.title: Trump Might Get Us Into Another War. Where’s Congress?
item.description: It’s time for the legislative branch to step up.

item.title: Trump’s $499 ‘built in the U.S.’ smartphone will likely be made in China, analysts say, making it subject to his own tariff policy
item.description: “The idea that [manufacturing] could be replicated in the U.S. in any sort of short- to medium-term time scale is fanciful,” one analyst said.

item.title: Amazon’s AI boss reveals the make-or-break trait that decides whether you get hired—and it can’t be faked, rehearsed, or tested for

item.title: Meta’s $100 million signing bonuses for OpenAI staff are just the latest sign of extreme AI talent war
item.description: Big Tech companies are shelling out jaw-dropping compensation amid a fierce AI talent war.
